greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number having exactly n representations as ab+ac+bc with 0 < a < b < c.
comment: Note that the Mathematica program computes A094376, A094377 and A094378, but outputs only this sequence.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..826
example: a(2) = 23 because 23 is the least number with 2 representations: (a,b,c) = (1,2,7) and (1,3,5).
maple: f:= proc(n) local a, t, s;
for a from 1 to floor(sqrt(n/3)) do
t:= t + nops(select(s -> s > 2*a and n+a^2 > s^2, numtheory:-divisors(n+a^2)))
for n from 1 while count < N+1 do
v:= f(n); if v <= N and V[v] = 0 then
mathematica: cntMax=10; nSol=Table[{0, 0, 0}, {cntMax+1}]; Do[lim=Ceiling[(n-2)/3]; cnt=0; Do[If[n>a*b && Mod[n-a*b, a+b]==0 && Quotient[n-a*b, a+b]>b, cnt++; If[cnt>cntMax, Break[]]], {a, 1, lim-1}, {b, a+1, lim}]; If[cnt<=cntMax, If[nSol[[cnt+1, 1]]==0, nSol[[cnt+1, 1]]=n]; nSol[[cnt+1, 2]]=n; nSol[[cnt+1, 3]]++;], {n, 10000}]; Table[nSol[[i, 1]], {i, cntMax+1}]
xref: Cf. A000926 (n having no representations), A093669 (n having one representation), A025052, A094377, A094378.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 28 2004
